Archaeological Site: MEDINET HABU (EXCEPT TEMPLE OF RAMESSES III)
Name: Small bronze bell
Description: Small bronze bell with suspension ring, now broken. During the late Roman Period bells were introduced into Egypt from Western Asia for use in churches. This example was found at Medinet Habu in the precinct of the temple of Ramesses III, part of which was converted into a Christian shrine by the fourth century AD. The area between the main temple building and its enclosure wall was the principal town on the West Bank at Thebes in the Christian Period.
